author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘Don’t accidentally kill someone’: Ore. Gov. begs public to keep Thanksgiving small
description: “I’m asking Oregonians to make additional sacrifices on top of the sacrifices they have made all year,” says Gov. Kate Brown discussing Thanksgiving celebrations amid the pandemic. “Keep it small. Don’t accidentally kill someone.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump Covid-19 adviser tells Americans to ‘rise up’ against safety measures
description: Chris Hayes: “Atlas is actively rooting on the virus, trying to extract a political penalty from people who are doing the best they can under abominable circumstances.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Ga. Sec. of State says Lindsey Graham suggested he find a way to toss legal ballots
description: On Monday, Georgia's Republican Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger told the Washington Post he has come under increasing pressure from Republicans—including Sen. Lindsey Graham—to throw away legal ballots.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘Trump still owns the GOP’: Incoming GOP House Freshmen adopt Trump’s lying ways
description: As Joy says, ‘Trump still owns the GOP.’ Even with the president on his way out, incoming Republican House Freshmen have been emboldened by his lying ways.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Joy Reid: 'Trump is going for the biggest lie of all, that he won the election'
description: With President Trump still refusing to concede in the presidential election that he lost, Joy says he’s going for ‘the biggest lie of all.’
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Trump’s response to the pandemic: ‘Frankly, he hasn’t been any help’
description: On President Trump’s mishandling of the pandemic, New York Governor Andrew Cuomo says Trump hasn’t been any help and he looks forward to working with President-Elect Joe Biden.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'Dunces': Trump losing and admitting defeat in 2020 cases as Giuliani implodes

source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: As lawyers flee, Trump's floundering legal quest falls to familiar hands
description: Ali Velshi reports on more lawyers quitting on Donald Trump as his embarrassing failures to challenge his election loss pile up, leaving the job to Rudy Giuliani and a familiar cast of Fox News commentators.
content: Ali Velshi reports on more lawyers quitting on Donald Trump as his embarrassing failures to challenge his election loss pile up, leaving the job to Rudy Giuliani and a familiar cast of Fox News comme… [+20 chars]

author: MSNBC.com
title: Graham denies pressuring GA official to throw out legal votes
description: Georgia's Republican Secretary of State is alleging that Sen. Lindsey Graham pressured him to throw out legal votes in that state's recount. Jason Johnson and Jon Meacham join to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Biden warns Trump's transition delays may cause deaths
description: As Trump still refuses to concede his election loss to Joe Biden, the president-elect is warning that the delay in transition could cost lives with the Covid-19 crisis getting worse.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Bob Woodward: Trump testing how far people will go along with him
description: Two-time Pulitzer Prize-winning author Bob Woodward tells Lawrence O'Donnell that Donald Trump is testing the waters to see how far Republicans and White House aides will support his refusal to concede.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Lawrence: Trump's GSA head is an ‘enemy of the voters’
description: Lawrence O’Donnell explains how Emily Murphy is violating her oath of office as Trump’s appointed head of the General Services Administration by failing to sign the legal documents that begin the presidential transition process.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Biden ramps up pressure on Trump to engage in transition
description: President-elect Biden is turning up the pressure on Trump and his administration for failing to move ahead with a peaceful transition of power.
source.name: MSNBC

author: Hayes Brown
title: Covid-19's worst to come is already here. Denial will only make it worse.
description: The election divided us. But we need to work with each other if we're going to get through this pandemic winter.
content: There's a line in Shakespeare's "Richard III" that people tend to misinterpret. It has intermittently popped into my head throughout the pandemic. "Now is the winter of our discontent," Richard decla… [+9106 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Doctor calls for 'national comprehensive plan' on virus
description: Member of President-elect Biden's transition team, Dr. Atul Gawande, joins Morning Joe to discuss the announcement of two vaccines to fight the coronavirus and a national comprehensive plan to fight the virus.
source.name: MSNBC

author: Steve Benen
title: Did Lindsey Graham push Georgia to throw out legally cast ballots?
description: Georgia's secretary of state claims Lindsey Graham pressured him directly, questioning the validity of legally cast absentee ballots.
content: It was last week when much of the Republican Party turned on Brad Raffensperger, Georgia's Republican secretary of state. GOP Sens. David Purdue and Kelly Loeffler got the ball rolling, calling for R… [+4035 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Obama to sit down with Jonathan Capehart for exclusive interview
description: Following the release of his new book, President Barack Obama will sit down with The Washington Post's Jonathan Capehart for an exclusive interview, which will be aired on MSNBC Thursday at 10 PM ET.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Chicago mayor: We are urging people to stay at home
description: Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot issued a stay-at-home advisory effective Monday as the city is experiencing a rise in coronavirus cases. Mayor Lightfoot joins Morning Joe to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: Steve Benen
title: Need for economic aid is obvious, but it's not happening
description: "We will have a tremendous stimulus package immediately after the election," Trump said four days before Election Day. If only he'd meant it.

author: Steve Benen
title: Trump's lawyers play an unfortunate game of musical chairs
description: It was a bad sign when one of the two law firms representing Trump decided it no longer wanted to be part of a key case. Last night, it got just a little worse.
content: When it comes to Donald Trump's legal strategy in the wake of his election defeat, the president is suffering a series of cascading embarrassments. First and foremost, of course, is the courtroom def… [+2180 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Biden announces new additions to White House team
description: President-elect Joe Biden announced new additions to his White House team to help provide "diverse perspectives." NBC's Geoff Bennett reports on who was chosen and how this impacts the transition process.
source.name: MSNBC

author: Steve Benen
title: GOP senator backs off vow to help Biden with intel briefings
description: Last week, Oklahoma's James Lankford suggested national security has to take precedence over post-election political posturing. Then he changed his mind.
content: Late last week, several Republican officials conceded that, in the interest of U.S. national security, President-elect Joe Biden should start receiving classified intelligence briefings. Last week, S… [+2260 chars]

author: Steve Benen
title: A week later, Texas' Dan Patrick still has his $1 million
description: Texas Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick (R) no doubt thought it was a good idea to offer financial rewards for evidence of voter fraud. He was mistaken.
content: After Election Day had come and gone, Donald Trump and many of his allies did what Republicans often do: they alleged widespread "voter fraud" without any evidence. As the Texas Tribunenoted a week a… [+1639 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Acting Defense Secretary Miller announces troop reduction in Iraq and Afghanistan
description: Acting Secretary of Defense Christopher Miller announced that there would be a reduction in American forces in Iraq and Afghanistan by this January. NBC's Courtney Kube has details.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Chuck: 'Hope of tomorrow is being consumed by the fear and chaos' of today
description: Chuck Todd says, "finally, it seems, there is a glimmer of light at the end of this tunnel. ... Unfortunately for many Americans, the hope of tomorrow is being consumed by the fear and chaos and dysfunction of today."
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Scott Galloway: ‘We need to protect people, not companies’
description: Over the past months, we’ve seen big businesses thriving as many small businesses collapse. NYU professor and best-selling author Scott Galloway joins Stephanie Ruhle to discuss why small businesses have become “the poodles looking for a handout” instead of t…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘We're not asking for a handout, we're just asking for some help’: Tom Colicchio on aid for restaurants
description: We know small businesses need help right now, especially in the restaurant industry. Founder of Crafted Hospitality and the head judge on Bravo’s “Top Chef,” Tom Colicchio joins Stephanie Ruhle to explain if there’s a more targeted way to help them.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Election Law Analyst on Trump lawsuits: This isn't a 'coherent legal strategy'
description: It's only Tuesday, and it has already been a VERY tough week for Trump Campaign lawyers. University of Virginia Law Lecturer and MSNBC Election Law Analyst, Matt Sanderson joins Katy Tur to discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: Liz Plank
title: Dear Candace Owens: The manliest men in history wore dresses, too
description: Contrary to what Candace Owens says, Harry Styles joins a legacy of historically manly men who famously wear dresses.

author: MSNBC.com
title: Dr. Lipi Roy and Dr. Murtaza Akhter answer MSNBC viewer questions on the COVID-19 vaccine

source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Kara Swisher calls social media platforms ‘an almost perfect system for propaganda’
description: Co-host of the “Pivot” podcast Kara Swisher and brand and marketing expert Donny Deutsch discuss the role of social media in the spread of disinformation and whether tech companies should be doing more to minimize it
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Mark Salter says Donald Trump’s ‘fragile psyche takes nourishment from our distress’
description: Former advisor to Senator John McCain, Mark Salter, warns that Trump will try to “burn it all down” before he leaves office, and calls on Republicans to not turn their backs on our country’s principles
source.name: MSNBC

author: Hayes Brown
title: Lindsey Graham is clearly lost in the sauce
description: South Carolina senator Lindsey Graham is backing Donald Trump's false election fraud claims despite no longer needing to pander to the far-right or GOP base.
